intro: Scorzonera aragatzii, commonly known as the Armenian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellow flower heads. The plant produces small, oval-shaped tubers that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera aragatzii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
